channel.title: New at The Book of Secret Knowledge
channel.description: New at The Book of Secret Knowledge

item.title: update openssl one-liners v3
item.description:
postalAddress = "Keller" # L/postaladdress=
Example of `oids` (you'll probably also have to make OpenSSL know about the new fields required for EV by adding the following under `[new_oids]`):
```
[req]
...
oid_section = new_oids
[ new_oids ]
postalCode = 2.5.4.17
streetAddress = 2.5.4.9
```
For more information please look at these great explanations:
- [RFC 5280](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5280)
- [How to create multidomain certificates using config files](https://apfelboymchen.net/gnu/notes/openssl%20multidomain%20with%20config%20files.html)
- [Generate a multi domains certificate using config files](https://gist.github.com/romainnorberg/464758a6620228b977212a3cf20c3e08)
- [Your OpenSSL CSR command is out of date](https://expeditedsecurity.com/blog/openssl-csr-command/)
- [OpenSSL example configuration file](https://www.tbs-certificats.com/openssl-dem-server-cert.cnf)

item.title: add 'Linux Kernel Teaching'
item.description: :small_orange_diamond: Linux Kernel Teaching - is a collection of lectures and labs Linux kernel topics.

item.title: add 'dnsgrep' and 'rapid7 datasets'
item.description:
:small_orange_diamond: DNSGrep - quickly searching large DNS datasets.

  :small_orange_diamond: Rapid7 Labs Open Data - is a great resources of datasets from Project Sonar.

item.title: add 'OWASP Threat Dragon'
item.description: :small_orange_diamond: OWASP Threat Dragon - is a tool used to create threat model diagrams and to record possible threats.

item.title: add 'FreeBSD Journal'
item.description: :small_orange_diamond: FreeBSD Journal - it is a great list of periodical magazines about FreeBSD and other important things.

item.title: fix typo
item.description:
# User
# Group:

item.title: add new 'find' oneliners
item.description:
###### Find files and directories for specific user/group
# User:
find /etc -type f -user -name "*.conf"
# Group:
find /opt -group
find /etc -type f -group -iname "*.conf"
```
###### Find files and directories for all without specific user/group
```bash
# User:
find . \! -user -print
# Group:
find . \! -group
###### Looking for files/directories that only have certain permission
# User:
find . -user -perm -u+rw # -rw-r--r--
find /home -user $(whoami) -perm 777 # -rwxrwxrwx
find /home -type d -group -perm 755 # -rwxr-xr-x

item.title: add 'h2spec' and 'h2t'
item.description:
:small_orange_diamond: h2spec - is a conformance testing tool for HTTP/2 implementation.

  :small_orange_diamond: h2t - is a simple tool to help sysadmins to hardening their websites.
